attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs:
{"result": " To run mlflow.evaluate(), you will need to have MLflow installed and set up in your environment. Then, you can use the MLflow Evaluate function in conjunction with the Prompt Engineering UI or Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to evaluate your machine learning models. You can also use the MLflow Deployments Server to manage access to GenAI services and evaluate your applications. For more specific instructions, you can refer to the MLflow documentation or guides on how to use these features.", "source_documents": [{"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/index.html", "title": "MLflow: A Tool for Managing the Machine Learning Lifecycle — MLflow 2.15.1 documentation", "language": "en"}, "page_content": "Discover how to use MLflow Evaluate with the Prompt Engineering UI

Guides

                Learn how to work with RAG systems in MLflow
            

                View the hands-on LangChain RAG Guide

MLflow: A Tool for Managing the Machine Learning Lifecycle


MLflow: A Tool for Managing the Machine Learning Lifecycle 
MLflow is an open-source platform, purpose-built to assist machine learning practitioners and teams in
handling the complexities of the machine learning process. MLflow focuses on the full lifecycle for
machine learning projects, ensuring that each phase is manageable, traceable, and reproducible.", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/index.html", "title": "MLflow: A Tool for Managing the Machine Learning Lifecycle — MLflow 2.15.1 documentation", "language": "en"}, "page_content": "Learn about how to instrument your GenAI Workloads with MLflow Tracing


Guides


                    Learn how to leverage Tracing in MLflow
                

                    View the Tracing Guide for more information on tracing
                

                    Learn how to use MLflow autologging with OpenAI for automated trace logging
                

                    Discover the automated LangChain trace logging with MLflow autologging
                


Explore the Prompt Engineering UI


Quickstarts

                Learn how to use the Prompt Engineering UI


Learn about managed access to GenAI services with the MLflow Deployments Server


Guides

                Learn how to use the MLflow Deployments Server


                View the in-depth Guide for the MLflow Deployments Server


Learn about GenAI Evaluation


Guides

                Learn how to evaluate your GenAI applications with MLflow", "type": "Document"}, {"id": null, "metadata": {"source": "https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/index.html", "title": "MLflow: A Tool for Managing the Machine Learning Lifecycle — MLflow 2.15.1 documentation", "language": "en"}, "page_content": "MLflow Getting Started Resources 
If this is your first time exploring MLflow, the tutorials and guides here are a great place to start. The emphasis in each of these is
getting you up to speed as quickly as possible with the basic functionality, terms, APIs, and general best practices of using MLflow in order to
enhance your learning in area-specific guides and tutorials.

MLflow: A Tool for Managing the Machine Learning Lifecycle


MLflow: A Tool for Managing the Machine Learning Lifecycle 
MLflow is an open-source platform, purpose-built to assist machine learning practitioners and teams in
handling the complexities of the machine learning process. MLflow focuses on the full lifecycle for
machine learning projects, ensuring that each phase is manageable, traceable, and reproducible.

Learn about how to instrument your GenAI Workloads with MLflow Tracing


Guides


                    Learn how to leverage Tracing in MLflow
                

                    View the Tracing Guide for more information on tracing
                

                    Learn how to use MLflow autologging with OpenAI for automated trace logging
                

                    Discover the automated LangChain trace logging with MLflow autologging
                


Explore the Prompt Engineering UI


Quickstarts

                Learn how to use the Prompt Engineering UI


Learn about managed access to GenAI services with the MLflow Deployments Server


Guides

                Learn how to use the MLflow Deployments Server


                View the in-depth Guide for the MLflow Deployments Server


Learn about GenAI Evaluation


Guides

                Learn how to evaluate your GenAI applications with MLflow

MLflow Getting Started Resources 
If this is your first time exploring MLflow, the tutorials and guides here are a great place to start. The emphasis in each of these is
getting you up to speed as quickly as possible with the basic functionality, terms, APIs, and general best practices of using MLflow in order to
enhance your learning in area-specific guides and tutorials.


Learn about MLflowMLflow BasicsMLflow Models IntroductionGenAI QuickstartsDeep Learning Quickstarts
Learn about the core components of MLflow


Quickstarts

                Get Started with MLflow in our 5-minute tutorial

Guides

                Learn the core components of MLflow with this in-depth guide to Tracking


Learn how to perform common tasks in MLflow


Guides

Autologging tutorial for effortless model tracking
            

Model Signatures and type validation in MLflow
            

Model Deployment Quickstart


Hyperparameter tuning with MLflow
            

Learn about MLflow Model-related topics"}
attributes.mlflow.spanOutputs: {"text": " To run mlflow.evaluate(), you will need to have MLflow installed and set up in your environment. Then, you can use the MLflow Evaluate function in conjunction with the Prompt Engineering UI or Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) to evaluate your machine learning models. You can also use the MLflow Deployments Server to manage access to GenAI services and evaluate your applications. For more specific instructions, you can refer to the MLflow documentation or guides on how to use these features."}

MLflow: A Tool for Managing the Machine Learning Lifecycle


MLflow: A Tool for Managing the Machine Learning Lifecycle 
MLflow is an open-source platform, purpose-built to assist machine learning practitioners and teams in
handling the complexities of the machine learning process. MLflow focuses on the full lifecycle for
machine learning projects, ensuring that each phase is manageable, traceable, and reproducible.

Learn about how to instrument your GenAI Workloads with MLflow Tracing


Guides

getting you up to speed as quickly as possible with the basic functionality, terms, APIs, and general best practices of using MLflow in order to
enhance your learning in area-specific guides and tutorials.
